sarah_parents.q1: As she hasn't seen them for a few weeks.
sarah_parents: The sentence mentions parents, then states 'when she gets to her parent's house, suggesting there is only 1 parent now.
blue_team.q1: The rabbit logo could be either team's logo, as both teams are mentioned in the first sentence.  The last sentence re-mentions the blue team, suggesting that the red team are the ones with the rabbit logo. Plus in football the home team are usually mentioned first, so they would not be wearing away gear.
blue_team: They are ahead by four goals at half time, but it doesn't mention what the overall score is.
bill_holiday.q1: As he has been working hard for months.
bill_holiday: A whole section regarding, Bill's choice of holiday and how he arrived at packing his suitcase. then a further section about getting to his destination.
john_party: How does he prepare the potatoes without the peeler?
rebecca_swimming.q1: Go for a swim in the sea.
rebecca_swimming: There is no reference to any initial conversation with the lifeguard.  I can't imagine he would make that comment without prior conversation.
sally_wine: It doesn't say whether Sally actually went in the shop and bought anything.
belinda_meeting: The text assumes we know how she transferred from the airport to taxi; that we knew that the meeting was in an office block (type of venue).
lucy_loan: Why did she get a car loan, when her car is worth thousands?  Why would she get a loan first without having her original car valued.
michael_breakfast: I would have thought Michael would have already been in the kitchen because he had gone downstairs to have his breakfast. Why was he putting tea bags in the teapot, as opposed to tea leaves?  I would have thought he would have used teabags at university.
sean_call: The initial sentence infers that it is difficult for him to speak to his mother, yet he has a mobile phone.  Once he dials the number, you would expect the next sentence to refer to the conversation, not the signal.
